docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THROUGH inattention or lack of direction, the National Institutes of Health is failing to follow its own policy of actively including women in medical research studies, the General Accounting Office contended yesterday.
docs.snippet: LEAD: THROUGH inattention or lack of direction, the National Institutes of Health is failing to follow its own policy of actively including women in medical research studies, the General Accounting Office contended yesterday.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AS the sun arcs toward the summer solstice and swarms of unregenerate sunbathers head for the beach, scientists are struggling mightily to undo the damage of profligate tanning. They are racing to devise new therapies against malignant melanoma, the deadly skin cancer that is rising faster than any other cancer in the world.

headline.main: Scientists Struggle to Undo Tanning's Deadly Damage
